group.label: General
group.comment: For more information about EffectConnect Marketplaces go to the EffectConnect website (www.effectconnect.com).

group.label: Catalog Export
group.comment: All settings related to the catalog export from the current Magento 2 installation to a EffectConnect Marketplaces connection.

field.label: Schedule
field.comment: Determines if and when the catalog export process will run.

field.label: Custom schedule
field.comment: Determines when the catalog export process will run (using cron expression format).

field.label: Page size
field.comment: The number of products per page when obtaining the catalog for the catalog export.

field.label: Brand attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute that is used for obtaining the product's brand when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces.

field.label: Title attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute that is used for obtaining the product's title when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces.

field.label: Description attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute that is used for obtaining the product's description when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces.

field.label: Export EAN
field.comment: Select whether the EAN attribute should be included in the catalog export.

field.label: When EAN invalid
field.comment: EffectConnect only supports products with a valid EAN or products without an EAN.

field.label: EAN attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute that is used for obtaining the product's EAN (European Article Number) when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces.

field.label: Add leading zero to EAN
field.comment: Select whether the plugin should automatically add a leading zero to an EAN that consists of 12 characters.

field.label: Cost attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute that is used for obtaining the product's cost price when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces.

field.label: Delivery time attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute that is used for obtaining the product's delivery time when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces.

field.label: Price determination
field.comment: Use 'Default Magento price determination' to export prices as they appear in the catalog (takes special prices and catalog sales rules into account). The original price will be exported as original price attribute. Extra settings will appear below when choosing 'Advanced price determination'.

field.label: Price attribute
field.comment: Select the attribute that is used for obtaining the product's price when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces.

field.label: Price fallback
field.comment: Determines when choosing the non-default price attribute in the setting above, the default Magento 2 price attribute should be used when the custom attribute is empty.

field.label: Use special price
field.comment: Select whether the default Magento 2 special price attribute should be used when exporting the catalog to EffectConnect Marketplaces. The original price will just as well be exported, but in that case as original price attribute.

group.label: Offer Export
group.comment: All settings related to the offer (stock, price and delivery time) export from the current Magento 2 installation to a EffectConnect Marketplaces connection.

field.label: Schedule
field.comment: Determines if and when the offer export process will run.

field.label: Custom schedule
field.comment: Determines when the offer export process will run (using cron expression format).

field.label: Export on product change
field.comment: Determines if the offer for a product should be exported when the product changes (event based).

field.label: Queue size
field.comment: The number of offer exports from the queue handled per minute. Offer exports are placed in the queue when a product changes (like stock, price, etc.).

field.label: Page size
field.comment: The number of products per page when obtaining the catalog for the offer export.

field.label: MSI active
field.comment: Determines whether Magento MSI is available, enabled and active in the current Magento version and configuration.

field.label: Quantity type
field.comment: Determines whether the physical stock quantity, the salable stock quantity or the traditional (non-MSI) quantity should be used. The salable quantity is the physical quantity minus the ordered quantity in non-shipped orders and is the default stock quantity source in Magento 2.3 and up.

field.label: Salable source
field.comment: Select whether to base a product's salable stock quantity on a website or on a stock. This is only used to obtain the stock quantity from. When orders are placed, the stock will be reduced using the Magento Source Selection Algorithm and the Channel Mapping. A separate store-view is needed to influence the source priority when it's not equal to the default one.

field.label: Website (salable source)
field.comment: Select the website to base the salable stock quantity for a product on. This is only used to obtain the stock quantity from. When orders are placed, the stock will be reduced using the Magento Source Selection Algorithm and the Channel Mapping. A separate store-view is needed to influence the source priority when it's not equal to the default one.

field.label: Stock (salable source)
field.comment: Select the stock to base the salable stock quantity for a product on. This is only used to obtain the stock quantity from. When orders are placed, the stock will be reduced using the Magento Source Selection Algorithm and the Channel Mapping. A separate store-view is needed to influence the source priority when it's not equal to the default one.

field.label: MSI stock selection
field.comment: Select the Magento MSI source whether the quantity should be used by predefined sources, sources in predefined stocks or sources defined on product level.

field.label: Sources (MSI)
field.comment: Select the sources to base the stock quantity on for a product. This is only used to obtain the stock quantity from. When orders are placed, the stock will be reduced using the Magento Source Selection Algorithm and the Channel Mapping. A separate store-view is needed to influence the source priority when it's not equal to the default one.

field.label: Stocks (MSI)
field.comment: Select the stocks to base the stock quantity on for a product. This is only used to obtain the stock quantity from. When orders are placed, the stock will be reduced using the Magento Source Selection Algorithm and the Channel Mapping. A separate store-view is needed to influence the source priority when it's not equal to the default one.

field.label: Stock tracking
field.comment: When enabled the products will use the individual stock. When disabled a fictional stock is used for all products in the export.

field.label: Fictional stock
field.comment: The stock amount used for all products in the export, when stock tracking is disabled.

group.label: Order Import
group.comment: All settings related to the order import from a EffectConnect Marketplaces connection to the current Magento 2 installation.

field.label: Schedule
field.comment: Determines if and when the order import process will run.

field.label: Custom schedule
field.comment: Determines when the order import process will run (using cron expression format).

field.label: Payment method
field.comment: Select the payment method for imported orders.

field.label: Shipping method
field.comment: Select the shipping method for imported orders.

field.label: Order status
field.comment: Select the order status for imported orders. Leave empty to use the status given by EffectConnect.

field.label: Create (or load an existing) customer
field.comment: Set to 'No' to import the order as guest. Set to 'Yes' to add the order to a customer (a new one will be created if it doesn't exist).

field.label: Assign customer to group
field.comment: The customer group to use for newly created customers. Existing customers will not be affected.

field.label: Create invoice
field.comment: Whether or not an invoice needs to be created when importing an order.

field.label: Send emails
field.comment: Whether or not to send an email to the customer for each imported order.

group.label: Shipment Export
group.comment: All settings related to the order shipment export from the current Magento 2 installation to a EffectConnect Marketplaces connection.

field.label: When to send shipments to EffectConnect
field.comment: We can only update shipments in EffectConnect once. Set to 'When shipment is created' in case you have no tracking codes or when tracking codes are added to Magento at the same time the shipment is created. Set to 'When tracking code is added to a shipment' in case shipments are created and tracking codes are added to the shipments later.

field.label: Queue size
field.comment: The number of order shipment exports from the queue handled per minute. Order shipment exports are placed in the queue when an order is shipped with tracking number.

group.label: Log
group.comment: All settings related to the logging behaviour for the EffectConnect Marketplaces log.

field.label: Log expiration
field.comment: Select how long the log should be preserved before the expired entries will automatically be removed from the log.

field.label: Page size
field.comment: The number of log items per page when obtaining the log items for the log export.

group.label: Advanced
group.comment: All advanced settings for the EffectConnect Marketplaces plugin. Be careful when adjusting these settings.

field.label: API call time-out
field.comment: The number of seconds before an API call should time out.
